==Events==
*[[1395]] &ndash; [[Battle of Rovine]], [[Wallachia]]ns defeat an invading [[Ottoman Empire|Ottoman]] army.
*[[1521]] &ndash; [[Edward Stafford, 3rd Duke of Buckingham]], is [[Capital punishment|executed]] for [[treason]].
*[[1536]] &ndash; [[George Boleyn, Viscount Rochford]] and four other men are executed for treason.
*[[1536]] &ndash; The annulment of [[Henry VIII]] and [[Anne Boleyn]]’s marriage.
*[[1590]] &ndash; [[Anne of Denmark]] is crowned [[Queen consort|Queen]] of [[Scotland]].
*[[1642]] &ndash; [[Paul Chomedey de Maisonneuve]] (1612–1676) founds the [[Montreal|Ville Marie de Montréal]].
*[[1673]] &ndash; [[Louis Joliet]] and [[Jacques Marquette]] begin exploring the [[Mississippi River]].
*[[1775]] &ndash; [[American Revolutionary War]]: the [[Continental Congress]] bans trade with [[Province of Quebec (1763-1791)|Quebec]].
*[[1792]] &ndash; The [[New York Stock Exchange]] is formed under the [[Buttonwood Agreement]].
*[[1805]] &ndash; [[Muhammad Ali of Egypt|Muhammad Ali]] becomes [[Wāli]] of [[Egypt]].
*[[1808]] &ndash; [[Napoleon I of France]] orders the [[annexation]] of the [[Papal States]] to the [[First French Empire|French Empire]].
*[[1814]] &ndash; [[Military occupation|Occupation]] of [[Monaco]] changes from [[France|French]] to [[Austria]]n.
*  1814   &ndash; The [[Constitution of Norway]] is signed and [[Crown Prince]] [[Christian VIII of Denmark|Christian Frederick]] of [[Denmark]] is elected [[King of Norway]] by the [[Norwegian Constituent Assembly]].
*[[1849]] &ndash; [[St. Louis Fire (1849)|A large fire]] nearly burns [[St. Louis, Missouri]] to the ground.
*[[1863]] &ndash; [[Rosalía de Castro]] publishes ''Cantares Gallegos'', the first book in the [[Galician language]].
*[[1865]] &ndash; The International Telegraph Union (later the [[International Telecommunication Union]]) is established in [[Paris]].
*[[1869]] &ndash; Imperial [[Empire of Japan|Japanese]] forces defeat the remnants of the [[Tokugawa shogunate]] in the [[Battle of Hakodate]] to end the [[Boshin War]].
*[[1875]] &ndash; [[Aristides (horse)|Aristides]] wins the first [[Kentucky Derby]].
*[[1900]] &ndash; [[Second Boer War]]: [[United Kingdom|British]] troops relieve [[Siege of Mafeking|Mafeking]].
*[[1902]] &ndash; [[Greeks|Greek]] archaeologist [[Valerios Stais]] discovers the [[Antikythera mechanism]], an [[ancient]] [[machine|mechanical]] [[analog computer]].
*[[1914]] &ndash; The [[Protocol of Corfu]] is signed, recognising [[Autonomous Republic of Northern Epirus|full autonomy]] to [[Northern Epirus]] under nominal [[Albania]]n sovereignty.
*[[1915]] &ndash; The last [[The Liberal Party (UK)|British Liberal Party]] government (led by [[Herbert Henry Asquith]]) falls.
*[[1933]] &ndash; [[Vidkun Quisling]] and [[Johan Bernhard Hjort]] form [[Nasjonal Samling]] &mdash; the [[Nazism|national-socialist]] party of [[Norway]].
*[[1939]] &ndash; The [[Columbia University|Columbia]] [[Columbia Lions|Lions]] and the [[Princeton University|Princeton]] [[Princeton Tigers|Tigers]] play in the United States' first televised sporting event, a [[college baseball|collegiate baseball]] game in [[New York City]].
*[[1940]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: [[Germany]] occupies [[Brussels]], [[Belgium]].
*  1940   &ndash; World War II: the old city centre of the [[Netherlands|Dutch]] town of [[Middelburg]] is bombed by the German [[Luftwaffe]], to force the surrender of the Dutch armies in [[Zeeland]].
*[[1943]] &ndash; World War II: the [[Dambuster Raids]] by [[No. 617 Squadron RAF]] on [[Nazi Germany|German]] dams.
*[[1954]] &ndash; The [[United States Supreme Court]] hands down a unanimous decision in ''[[Brown v. Board of Education]] of [[Topeka, Kansas]]''.
*[[1967]] &ndash; [[Six-Day War]]: [[President of Egypt|President]] [[Gamal Abdel Nasser]] of [[Egypt]] demands dismantling of the peace-keeping [[UN Emergency Force]] in Egypt.
*[[1969]] &ndash; [[Venera program]]: [[Soviet Union|Soviet]] ''[[Venera 6]]'' begins its descent into the [[atmosphere]] of [[Venus]], sending back atmospheric data before being crushed by pressure.
*[[1970]] &ndash; [[Thor Heyerdahl]] sets sail from [[Morocco]] on the [[papyrus]] boat ''[[Ra II]]'' to sail the [[Atlantic Ocean]].
*[[1973]] &ndash; [[Watergate scandal]]: Televised hearings begin in the [[United States Senate]].
*[[1974]] &ndash; [[The Troubles]]: [[Dublin and Monaghan bombings|Thirty-three civilians are killed]] and 300 injured when the [[Ulster Volunteer Force]] (UVF) detonates four car bombs in [[Dublin]] and [[Monaghan]], [[Republic of Ireland]]. It is the deadliest attack of the Troubles and the deadliest terrorist attack in the Republic's history. There are allegations that [[British security forces|British state forces]] were involved.
*  1974   &ndash; [[Los Angeles Police Department|Police]] in [[Los Angeles, California]], raid the [[Symbionese Liberation Army]]'s headquarters, killing six members, including [[Camilla Hall]].
*[[1980]] &ndash; General [[Chun Doo-hwan]] of [[South Korea]] [[Coup d'état of May Seventeenth|seizes control]] of the government and declares [[martial law]] in order to suppress student demonstrations.
*  1980   &ndash; On the eve of presidential elections, [[Maoism|Maoist]] [[guerrilla warfare|guerrilla]] group [[Shining Path]] attacks a polling location in the town of [[Chuschi]], [[Ayacucho]], starting the [[Internal conflict in Peru]].
*[[1983]] &ndash; The [[United States Department of Energy|U.S. Department of Energy]] declassifies documents showing world's largest [[Mercury (element)|mercury]] pollution event in [[Oak Ridge, Tennessee]] (ultimately found to be 4.2 million pounds), in response to the Appalachian Observer's [[Freedom of information legislation|Freedom of Information Act]] request.
*  1983   &ndash; [[Lebanon]], [[Israel]], and the [[United States]] sign an [[Israel-Lebanon peace treaty|agreement]] on [[Israel]]i withdrawal from [[Lebanon]].
*[[1984]] &ndash; [[Charles, Prince of Wales|Prince Charles]] calls a proposed addition to the [[National Gallery, London]], a "monstrous carbuncle on the face of a much-loved and elegant friend," sparking controversies on the proper role of the [[British Royal Family|Royal Family]] and the course of [[modern architecture]].
*[[1987]] &ndash; An [[Iraq]]i [[Dassault Mirage F1]] fighter jet [[USS Stark incident|fires two missiles]] into the [[U.S. Navy]] warship {{USS|Stark|FFG-31|6}}, killing 37 and injuring 21 of her crew.
*[[1990]] &ndash; The General Assembly of the [[World Health Organization]] (WHO) eliminates [[homosexuality]] from the list of psychiatric diseases.
*[[1992]] &ndash; Three days of [[Black May (1992)|popular protests]] against the government of [[Prime Minister of Thailand]] [[Suchinda Kraprayoon]] begin in [[Bangkok]], leading to a military crackdown that results in 52 officially confirmed deaths, many disappearances, hundreds of injuries, and over 3,500 arrests.
*[[1994]] &ndash; [[Malawi]] holds its [[Malawian general election, 1994|first multi-party elections]].
*[[1997]] &ndash; Troops of [[Laurent Kabila]] march into [[Kinshasa]]. [[Zaire]] is officially renamed [[Democratic Republic of the Congo]].
*[[2000]] &ndash; [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] and [[Galatasaray S.K.|Galatasaray]] fans clash in the [[2000 UEFA Cup Final riots]] in Copenhagen
*[[2004]] &ndash; The first legal [[same-sex marriage]]s in the [[United States|U.S.]] are performed in the state of [[Same-sex marriage in Massachusetts#First_same-sex_marriages|Massachusetts]].
*[[2006]] &ndash; The aircraft carrier {{USS|Oriskany|CV-34|6}} is sunk in the [[Gulf of Mexico]] as an [[artificial reef]].
*[[2007]] &ndash; Trains from [[North Korea|North]] and [[South Korea]] cross the [[38th parallel north|38th Parallel]] in a test-run agreed by both governments. This is the first time that trains have crossed the Demilitarized Zone since [[1953]].
*[[2013]] &ndash; Two [[Metro-North Railroad|Metro-North]] [[commuter train]]s [[Fairfield train crash|collide]] near [[Bridgeport, Connecticut]] injuring at least 72 people.
*[[2014]] &ndash; A [[2014 Lao People's Liberation Army Air Force An-74 crash|plane crash]] in northern [[Laos]] kills 17 people.
